page.title: 03CUSTOMS
page.content: {Biggar }is a burgh that is proud of its traditions of these the most famous is the {Neerday Bonfire}. The bonfire is an occasion of great festivity in the town and a parade lead by a piper marches up to the bonfire just before midnight to set light to the bonfire. There are older traditions like the {Biggar Play,} which was tradionally performed by the young children of the town,but it is no longer done and was only revived recently by the {Biggar Museum {Trust.}Another tradition that has disappeared is the battle that used to take place between the boys of Biggar and Knocklea,which took place near the Biggar burn. A more recent tradition is the Gala and the crowning of the { {Fleming Queen},which takes place in June.At the same time the Riding of the Marches takes place.
